triples.name: Diabetes
triples.relevance: Diabetes is the medical condition the paper aims to predict using machine learning algorithms.

triples.name: Data mining
triples.relevance: The paper applies data mining techniques to extract patterns from the diabetes dataset for prediction.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the overall field and approach used to build the diabetes prediction models.

triples.name: Artificial neural network
triples.relevance: Neural network methods are employed and evaluated as one of the prediction approaches in the study.

triples.name: Logistic regression
triples.relevance: Logistic regression is identified as one of the most effective algorithms for diabetes prediction in the paper.

triples.name: Support vector machine
triples.relevance: Support vector machine is identified as another highly effective algorithm for diabetes prediction alongside logistic regression.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: The Pima Indian Diabetes dataset used in the study is a well-known benchmark dataset commonly listed in machine learning research resources.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and evaluates a neural network model with different hidden layer configurations for diabetes prediction as a contribution.
